meanings.definition: Feeling or showing caution or apprehension
meanings.sent2: The cat became warier as the dog approached.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel looked warier than a detective in a mystery novel.
meanings.sent4: His eyes grew warier, like a soldier in enemy territory.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley made her feel warier than ever before.

meanings.definition: More cautious or apprehensive than someone else
meanings.sent1: He is warier than his brother when it comes to trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: She became warier than her friends after hearing the strange noise.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit was warier than a ninja trying to sneak past guards.
meanings.sent4: His warier approach to the situation saved them from danger.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds made the villagers warier than ever of the coming rain.
